posts.name: Elaine
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.49 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • We fixed a bug that sometimes prevented sharing a URL from another app using the iOS share sheet. We hope that your week was more exciting than ours.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.48 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.49.0.640-beta

50 new commits since 7.48.0.636-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.49 [1]

  • Remove old enclave [2]

  • Backup benching improvements [3]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.50.0 [4]

  • Make Bencher wrapEnumeration take a tx as input [5]

  • Separate Bencher into archive/restore benchers [6]

  • Drop logging related to individual-frame thresholds [7]

  • Update message request safety section [8]

  • Add "profile/group names are not verified" label [9]

  • Add profile names education to contact about sheet [10]

  • Fix AvatarDataState initializer [11]

  • Update SVR to be more fine-grained with restore/backup/expose side effects. [12]

  • Consolidate MBRK/BackupKey/AEP/MasterKey management into one place. [13]

  • Update API for storing master key from provisioning & sync messages [14]

  • Update SVR API to take explicit keys vs generating [15]

  • Add AEP class & update SVR API [16]

  • Add non-registration AEP changes [17]

  • Bulk of AEP registration changes. [18]

  • Cleanup after AEP changes [19]

  • Update RegistrationCoordinatorTests for both MasterKey & AEP [20]

  • Remove AEP & MasterKey protocols [21]

  • Simplify key storage [22]

  • Split out various key managment methods into AccountKeyStore [23]

  • Attempt SVR backup on startup if needed [24]

  • Small AEP cleanup [25]

  • Enable AEP for dev builds [26]

  • For now, don't pass system proxy settings to libsignal [27]

  • reduce usages of firstly [28]

  • Fix links shared from certain apps [29]

  • MessageBackup*Progress cleanup [30]

  • Separately report progress for recreating indexes during Backup import [31]

  • Add additional logging around call audio session state and sounds [32]

  • Fix ringing for group calls [33]

  • Update to libsignal v0.67.0 [34]

  • CDS: Treat more kinds of libsignal error as retryable [35]

  • Use new libsignal connect logic for CDS (again) […] [36]

  • Truly always set a bubble color on chat style protos [37]

  • convert promises to async/await in BadgeGiftingConfirmationViewController+Paypal.swift [38]

  • Ensure presented view controller is dismissed before presenting in AttachmentPrep [39] (reverted by [40])

  • Revert "Ensure presented view controller is dismissed before presenting in AttachmentPrep" [40] (reverts [39])

  • Ensure presented view controller is dismissed before presenting in AttachmentPrep [41]

  • unwind more promisekit [42]

  • remove another firstly [43]

  • remove pointless firstly calls that just wrap Guarantee.wrapAsync [44]

  • Treat kCFProxyTypeHTTPS as "proxy for https" rather than "using https" [45]

  • Allow cancelling the proxy reachability test [46]

  • Asyncify proxy connection checking […] [47]

  • Remove redundant message header text [48]

  • Update release notes [49]

  • Update translations [50]

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Still getting crashes while using iPadOS

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.49.0/bdec0c5e2b29e55c0c68e153b1eed1c53cb54cdc1c110ff4d164a3c6915e66d3.zip

I never realized iOS was behind Android in that in theory you could use your WearOS watch with Signal while on iOS you can’t see any call notifications or pick up the call from the Apple Watch.

1 new commit since 7.49.0.646-beta:

posts.name: 1din555go
posts.cooked: Since the update on December 1st, my app has stopped working. I can’t send or receive messages, and I can’t even open it at all. It’s been three months, and I’m worried about losing my data. I’ve seen on social media that other users are experiencing the same issue.I just updated again with no result.

posts.name: Max Radermacher
posts.cooked: Do you have any .ips crash reports available on your device? If you do, please send them to support@signal.org with a link to this forum post, and we’ll take a look.

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.50 release.
